originalText.text: I started coming to 180 Church 3 years ago when I moved to NYC from Indonesia. I actually got connected to its college ministry first, 180 Fellowship, which is an NYU club. Being an international student in NYC, I‚Äôve always longed to have a community where I belong. After all, I‚Äôm here on my own in a country that‚Äôs halfway across the world with no family, no friends, and no family friends. I‚Äôm really glad I found ‚Äúmy home‚Äù with 180 Church, where I met a lot of amazing and kind-hearted people. Now, some of my closest friends are actually members of the same church! Throughout my journey here, there have been a lot of ups and downs, and I‚Äôm so grateful that I have a whole community to support me all the way. I‚Äôm so proud to say that I got baptized 6 months ago in front of a community that I call ‚Äúmy home‚Äù. Not only has 180 Church challenged me to grow spiritually and emotionally, but it is also a community that challenges me to grow my leadership skills in the context of career development!  üè°üíï
